catList: This experiential subject is designed to develop managerial skills, cognitive as well as affective ones. It covers some basic functions of management; including communicating with others in local and global contexts. It addresses itself to issues and topics such as: understanding and appreciating other cultures, nations and their management styles; business practices in other countries; doing business with foreign companies; communicating with managers of other cultures and nations; business rhetoric; effective team work; and managing personal stress. Participants are expected to be active by involving in the development and implementation of this subject in their very immediate environment. Although a non-credit subject, it includes a set of issues most essential to the managers of the future.
